page.title: 17Housing in and around Wistow
page.content: The housing within this area is mainly confined to the villages of Little and Great Raveley and Wistow, apart from a few isolated farm houses. The Raveley's are both fairly small and undeveloped apart from a little in-filling. However, Wistow has a relativeley large number of modern houses with two small estates being built within the last l2 years and a few houses being built on individual plots. All three villages have council estates, built during the l920's and modernised about 5 years ago. Some of these have been purchased by the occupiers. Many older cottages have been modernised and extended, retaining their old world charm with oak beams and thatched roofs. Most buildings are of conventional brick construction and designed to fit in the rural location.
